thread.title: Study: Ebola in male survivors can survive up to 9 months
thread.title_full: Study: Ebola in male survivors can survive up to 9 months

title: Study: Ebola in male survivors can survive up to 9 months
text: Study: Ebola in male survivors can survive up to 9 months By Associated Press | October 14, 2015 @ 2:56 pm \n FILE - In this undated colorized transmission electron micrograph file image made available by the CDC shows an Ebola virus virion. For the first time, Ebola has been discovered inside the eyes of a patient months after the virus was gone from his blood, according to a report published Wednesday Oct. 14, 2015, in the New England Journal of Medicine. Doctors have found Ebola can survive in some male survivors for up to nine months after they first get sick but arenât sure if that means they might still be infectious, according to the new research published Wednesday. (Frederick Murphy/CDC via AP, File)\n
